metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Information Technology

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will work cross-functionally within CZI’s Central Tech teams and across the organization to deploy modern solutions that drive the work behind our mission.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will provide technical MLOps leadership for a team of MLOps Engineers, where you will manage and lead the team  in operating our heterogeneous AI training and inference systems as well as  collaborating in the design and build of our AI platform components.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Information Technology

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will play a key role in streamlining, securing, and optimizing our Payroll, Planning, and Absence management processes through the Workday platform. You will work closely with the Payroll, Finance, and Total Rewards  teams and be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements, translating requirements into technical specifications, ensuring compliance with IT security standards,  and implementing solutions.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Product

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will lead and build the product partnerships team that enables deep collaboration between Learning Commons and outside organizations in order to advance our overall strategy and objectives.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Legal and Grants

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will be fully integrated into the Investment team’s legal work, partnering closely with investment professionals and outside counsel on the legal aspects of public and private fund investments, co-investments, and related opportunities.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will play a crucial role in translating cutting-edge AI research and exploration into tangible tools and capabilities. You'll work on applying and scaling machine learning models to address specific educational challenges. You’ll have the opportunity to own significant features and contribute to the design of robust, scalable ML systems.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will guide the development of AI-driven virtual cell models that predict and generate novel cell states, leveraging CZI's significant investment in computational infrastructure (including a 1000 H100 GPU cluster) and unparalleled biological datasets. You'll devise and execute strategies to build generative AI models that learn the "accessible space" and predict cell types, structure, function, and dynamics—all while maintaining rigorous experimental validation and addressing biologically relevant questions that currently defy available methodologies.

jobs.title: President, Virtual Cell Models Program, Science

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Data

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will manage a team of technical program managers who are responsible for ensuring end-to-end delivery of the data technology platform required to achieve this vision of CZI Science.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Technical Program Management

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: As a Principal Technical Program Manager (TPM), AI  in the Science Technology organization, you will  lead a strategic projects focused on AI.  This role will partner closely with Product Management and Engineering Leadership to be the glue between strategy and execution, driving the planning and execution and ultimately the delivery of novel AI-based products for our Virtual Cell Platform.

jobs.title: Principal Technical Program Manager, ML/AI, Science

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Technical Program Management

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will provide support for the Scientific and Technical Directors to lead cross-functional teams in the planning, execution, and delivery of ambitious imaging science and technology projects.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Product

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will play a key part in shaping the development and direction of a new product with the potential to have a large impact on biomedical research.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Product

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will work on diverse projects and assignments while building your expertise in applied learning science within the educational technology space.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: People

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will partner closely with the Senior Compensation Manager, as well as the People team, Finance, and Business Systems, to deliver high-impact compensation solutions aligned with organizational goals.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Data

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will lead the creation of groundbreaking datasets that power our scientific grand challenge to build a virtual immune system—a cutting-edge initiative to determine the role of the immune system in disease and the molecular mechanisms through which it acts.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will drive initiatives that improve how internal teams access, use, and scale compute and platform resources—including onboarding and offboarding workflows, access management systems, and infrastructure programs that support efficient, secure, and impactful research and development across the organization.

jobs.title: Senior Director of AI Infrastructure & Engineering

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Information Technology

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: In this role, you will provide hands-on troubleshooting, manage AV systems, and coordinate with central teams in Redwood City for networking, accounts, and equipment requests. You will also serve as a solutions partner, mapping local needs to existing technologies and contributing to the design of new solutions for scientific use cases. This position is ideal for someone with expert troubleshooting skills, strong networking knowledge, and experience supporting research environments. Familiarity with high-performance computing (HPC) and AI systems is highly valued.

jobs.title: Senior IT/AV Engineer, End User Support, Central Tech

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will play a crucial role in translating cutting-edge AI research and exploration into tangible tools and capabilities. You'll work on applying and scaling machine learning models to address specific educational challenges. You’ll have the opportunity to own significant features and contribute to the design of robust, scalable ML systems.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Engineering

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will lead a team of software engineers, data scientists and machine learning engineers who build and maintain our rapidly growing set of evaluators that measure the educational suitability of AI systems.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Data Science and Software Engineering, Evaluators, Education

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will apply and optimize state-of-the-art models in artificial intelligence and machine learning to solve important problems in the biomedical sciences aligned with CZI’s mission.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Engineering

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You’ll design, develop, and maintain scalable full-stack web applications that power research workflows across scientific domains.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Engineering

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will design and develop scalable distributed software systems for imaging, computational biology, or data visualization and design stable and performant APIs for both internal and client-facing products.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Data

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will lead the creation of groundbreaking imaging datasets that decode cellular function at the molecular level, describe development, and predict responses to genetic or environmental changes.

jobs.title: Senior Staff Data Scientist, Imaging, Data, Science

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Data

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will shape the Data Science function for Insights, Analytics & Open Research Team, driving data strategy and implementation to monitor progress, assess scientific impact, and track the competitive landscape of CZI’s work in science.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Infrastructure & Security

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You'll partner with AI product and infrastructure teams to identify potential security risks early, assess them in context, and recommend practical mitigations. You will help teams understand security tradeoffs and make informed decisions, while also considering other related risks that affect model safety and responsible deployment.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Program Manager, AI Risk & Product Security, Central Technology

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Engineering

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will help implement all the data needs for our platforms, CELLxGENE Discover, CryoET, as well as the new platform we are building that has a focus on data for AI and the virtual cell, in order to enable scientists to further interrogate our very large and growing corpus of data without any need to download the data itself or have any computational expertise. You will work on a collaborative, multidisciplinary team to develop solutions for our scientist users to accelerate their workflows and accelerate the pace of scientific discovery.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: As a Research Engineer on the AI/ML team, you will apply and optimize state-of-the-art models in artificial intelligence and machine learning to solve important problems in the biomedical sciences aligned with CZI’s mission. You will work on a team responsible for developing and deploying ML models that use data developed by CZI and research partners all for the purpose of contributing to greater understanding of human cell function.

jobs.title: Staff Research Engineer, AI Engineering, Science

location.name: Chicago, IL (Hybrid); New York, NY (Hybrid); Redwood City, CA (Hybrid)

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You’ll lead the design and delivery of secure, scalable, and high-performance AI/ML compute infrastructure. You will architect and implement containerized AI/ML platforms using Kubernetes for heterogeneous, distributed environments.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You’ll design and implement secure-by-default infrastructure and services supporting AI/ML workloads. You will collaborate with AI/ML engineers, data engineers, and platform teams to integrate security best practice.

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer, AI Security, Central Technology

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Artificial Intelligence

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will develop and maintain the tooling and infrastructure that drives the entire data lifecycle at CZI, from ingestion and processing to secure storage and access. Your work will directly support cutting-edge research, AI model training, and data analysis across the organization.

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer, Data and AI Platforms, Central

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Technical Program Management

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value:
You will proactively focus on setting the direction and developing and executing the operational strategy that optimizes our resources across education.

In this role, you'll be a key leader within Learning Commons, responsible for developing and executing the operational strategy that maximizes our impact on students and educators. You'll collaborate closely with Education leadership, product, engineering, and partnerships to ensure alignment, drive efficient decision-making, and accelerate the delivery of transformative solutions.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Data

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will lead the orchestration of complex, cross-functional efforts to ensure that sequencing data flows reliably and securely into CZI’s data ecosystem.

metadata.name: Careers Page - Dept.
metadata.value: Data

metadata.name: Brief Description
metadata.value: You will ensure that CZI remains a global leader in leveraging data to advance biomedical science and change medicine for generations to come. The leader will serve as the connective tissue between experimental data generation and computational modeling efforts, ensuring the initiative builds a data foundation that enables breakthrough biological insights. The Vice President of Data will be a collaborative, forward-looking leader who thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment focused on delivering transformative science.
